title: Argentina Reels From Assassination Attempt on Its Vice President
description: The man who the authorities believe tried to shoot Cristina Fernández de Kirchner showed an interest in a mix of fringe ideologies, including the far right, his social media showed.

title: Hawaii Closes Its Last Coal-Fired Power Plant
description: A state law bans the use of coal for energy production beginning next year.

title: I.A.E.A. Head Warns of Grave Risk From Fighting Near Zaporizhzhia Plant
description: Rafael Mariano Grossi, the director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, said he was worried about increasing artillery combat around the Russian-occupied nuclear plant.

title: The U.N.’s nuclear agency is limited in its ability to enforce its recommendations on Zaporizhzhia.
South African Villagers Win Suit to Halt Shell’s Oil Exploration
description: A judicial panel ruled the energy giant had not properly consulted local communities, possibly setting a broader precedent for challenges to offshore drilling activities.

title: Iran Seizes, Then Releases Two U.S. Drones, Officials Say
description: The Navy called a similar incident this week “flagrant” and “unwarranted.”

title: John Podesta to Oversee $370 Billion in U.S. Climate Spending
description: Mr. Podesta, a Democratic stalwart, will oversee $370 billion in clean energy investments. Gina McCarthy, the president’s domestic climate adviser, is stepping down.

title: Gina McCarthy, Biden’s Top Climate Adviser, to Step Down Sept. 16
description: As the country’s first national climate adviser, Ms. McCarthy helped seed climate policy throughout the federal government.

title: Against Fierce Resistance, Ukraine Makes Small Gains in the South
description: Stepping up an offensive in the region near Kherson, Ukraine has retaken small villages. But officials predict a brutal winter ahead.

title: Join Al Gore and John Kerry for a Times Climate Event
description: How does climate change exacerbate other global challenges? Join us remotely or in person for our climate event series, with an upcoming gathering in New York in September.

title: Blast at Afghan Mosque Kills at Least 18, Including a Pro-Taliban Cleric
description: Among the casualties was Mawlawi Mujib Rahman Ansari, who had ties to the Taliban and was known for his criticism of the country’s previous Western-backed governments.

title: Kenya Awaits Supreme Court Ruling on Presidential Election
description: The Supreme Court is expected to rule by Monday on whether the recent election of William Ruto as president, now mired in a welter of conflicting accusations, should stand.

title: Argentina’s Vice President Unharmed After Assassination Attempt
description: A man tried to fire a gun inches from the head of Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, the country’s most prominent leader, but it did not go off.

title: U.N. Inspectors Gauge Risks at Nuclear Plant as Ukraine and Russia Trade Accusations
description: Russia and Ukraine appeared to be trying to frame a visit by the U.N. nuclear agency before inspectors present their findings.

title: Taiwan and Japan Are Brushed by Typhoon Hinnamnor. Korea’s Next.
description: The storm was the Northern Hemisphere’s strongest tropical cyclone of the year when it formed this week, but by Friday it had weakened slightly.

title: Myanmar’s Daw Aung San Suu Kyi Gets More Prison Time
description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the politician and Nobel laureate, was found guilty of election fraud on Friday, a sign that the junta has no intention of easing its pressure on her.

title: The Serena Effect
description: An improbable run at what may be her final U.S. Open.

title: Step Right Up, Mr. Tough Guy, and Try Enduring Menstrual Cramps
description: A campaign in India aims to end the shame and silence around monthly periods and to introduce better hygiene products.

title: ‘Magic in Her Hands.’ The Woman Bringing India’s Forests Back to Life
description: Tulsi Gowind Gowda has spent most of her more than 80 years planting and nurturing trees in southern India. “I like them more than anything else in my life,” she said.

title: Chile Could Transform Indigenous Rights in Watershed Vote
description: The proposed constitution would enshrine some of the world’s most extensive Indigenous rights. But those reforms have become the focal point of the campaign to reject the new text.

title: ‘Condemned to Lead’ Europe, German Chancellor Struggles for Impact
description: Facing its worst crisis since World War II, Europe is looking for leadership. Olaf Scholz is trying to take up the role, but faces a tepid response.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: President Biden speaks on democracy.

title: Behind the Scenes of an Afghan (Australian) Soccer Story
description: The story of a keeper and her teammates, as they fled and found new lives.

title: China Locks Down Chengdu as Covid Cases Rise
description: The drastic response to a rise in Covid cases adds to the pressures facing Sichuan Province, which already had been dealing with drought, heat and wildfires.

title: California Approves a Wave of Aggressive New Climate Measures
description: After lobbying by the governor, lawmakers adopted $54 billion in climate spending and voted to keep open the state’s last nuclear plant.

title: Zelensky says Russia prevented independent journalists from observing the I.A.E.A. mission.
Experts Brave Shelling to Reach Imperiled Ukrainian Nuclear Plant at Last
description: The team from the United Nations’ nuclear watchdog reached the Russian-occupied Zaporizhzhia plant for the first time since the war began, despite fresh shelling each side blamed on the other.

title: The Anglican Church’s ‘Kick in the Guts’ to Gay Parishioners
description: Divisions over the acceptance of homosexuality have proved intractable both on a global level and inside even liberal-leaning countries like New Zealand.
